VII.i.2.D.3.b
.
Example 1:  Surviving Spouse Who Meets Marriage Date Requirements of 38 CFR 3.54
Situation
:  The Veteran had honorable service from June 3, 1969, to June 2, 1973 (Vietnam Era).  The claimant married the Veteran on August 7, 1973, and remained married until the Veteran died on June 13, 1974.  There were no children born of the marriage.  The claimant files a claim for Survivors Pension as the Veteran’s surviving spouse on October 28, 2020.
Result
:  Since the claimant and the Veteran were not married for one year, and they had no children, the claimant would not be eligible if not for the fact that the marriage occurred before May 8, 1985.
Rationale
:  Since the Veteran had Vietnam Era service and the marriage occurred before the applicable delimiting date for Vietnam Era service (May 8, 1985), the claimant meets the marriage dates requirement.
title: M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section D - Establishing Marital Relationship in Survivors Cases
